randMeasures 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Get all measures

Source: R/functions.R
all_measures.Rd

Get all measures

Usage

all_measures(s, a = NULL, drop.r = NULL, maxOrder = 7)

Arguments

s

Sequence vector.

a

Optional. Vector of alternatives (e.g. 1:6 in a mental dice task).

drop.r

Optional. Whether to drop repetitions when calculating other measures

Value

A dataframe with all measures in the package

Examples

all_measures(sample(1:5, 100, T))
#> Calculating Adj, TPs and distances
#>   redundancy repetitions adjacency turning_points distances   coupon
#> 1  0.0135245   0.1818182 0.3535354       0.622449   1.59596 9.666667
#>   repetition_gap_med repetition_gap_mean       RNG      RNG2 NSQ cluster_ratio
#> 1                  3            4.842105 0.5135636 0.4829127   0      5.666667
#>   phase_length_1 phase_length_2 phase_length_3 phase_length_4 phase_length_5
#> 1      0.5833333      0.2833333      0.1166667              0              0
#>   fod_m5     fod_m4    fod_m3    fod_m2    fod_m1     fod_0    fod_p1    fod_p2
#> 1      0 0.02020202 0.1010101 0.1212121 0.1717172 0.1818182 0.1818182 0.1010101
#>       fod_p3     fod_p4 fod_p5     Phi_2    Phi_3      Phi_4     Phi_5
#> 1 0.07070707 0.05050505      0 -1.593029 2.789926 -0.2317344 -1.716976
#>       Phi_6      Phi_7
#> 1 0.2456266 -0.8192461
